benchmark_details.name: NuRisk: A Visual Question Answering Dataset for Agent-Level Risk Assessment in Autonomous Driving
benchmark_details.overview: NuRisk is a comprehensive Visual Question Answering (VQA) dataset comprising 2.9K scenarios and 1.1M agent-level samples, built on real-world data from nuScenes and Waymo, completed with safety-critical scenarios from the CommonRoad simulator, enabling spatio-temporal reasoning.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To enable agent-level quantitative risk reasoning in autonomous driving through a comprehensive VQA dataset.

data.source: Derived from nuScenes, Waymo scenarios, and synthetic scenarios from the CommonRoad simulator.
data.annotation: Physics-based risk annotations based on distance to collision and time to collision metrics.

methodology.calculation: Mean Absolute Error (MAE) for risk predictions; Quadratic Weighted Kappa (QWK) for agreement; standard metrics for evaluation.
methodology.interpretation: Lower MAE and higher QWK indicate better performance in risk assessment.
methodology.baseline_results: Peak accuracy of proprietary models was 33%, improved to 41% with fine-tuned models.
methodology.validation: Validation through automated quality checks and human validation on sampled data.
